item.title: Bitcoin
item.description: Introduction In the very first block of Bitcoin that was mined, Satoshi posted a message referencing a story in the UK newspaper The Times.

item.title: Ethereum
item.description: Bitcoin has a philosophy of only “soft-forking”, which means that every future network update must be backwards compatible. Hard forks, on the other hand, always create a chain split, the old chain is often abandoned, which Ethereum has managed to operationalize well.

item.description: Firestore vs. Firebase Google Cloud Run

item.title: Hedera Hashgraph
item.description: HBAR source: https://medium.com/@EidDany/hedera-hashgraph-vs-bitcoin-a-better-store-of-value-a0393fb2b822 HBAR is the Cryptocurrency used on the Hedera network. HBAR is a scarce commodity (Only 50 Billion HBAR will ever be minted ), it’s a useful digital good , sometimes referred to as a “Utility Token”, and is used for two purposes, to protect the network and transfer value between the network participants.

item.title: Proof of Stake
item.description: Introduction Proof of Stake is an alternative mechanism to Proof of Work used by many cryptocurrency networks to achieve consensus on which new blocks to add to their blockchains.

item.title: Proof of Work
item.description: Benefits & Issues of Proof of Work There’s a difference between users and miners (also known as block validators). Anyone can use a blockchain to make transactions or execute smart contracts.
